The Act may be cited as the "Hurricane Katrina Bankruptcy Relief and Community Protection Act of 2005". Definitions and eligibility criteria for debtors are outlined in the Act. The Act, known as the "Hurricane Katrina Bankruptcy Relief and Community Protection Act of 2005", includes amendments related to current monthly income and definitions of natural disasters. The amendments specify payments to victims of natural disasters and define a natural disaster as a major disaster or a similar situation. The Act, named the "Hurricane Katrina Bankruptcy Relief and Community Protection Act of 2005", includes amendments related to current monthly income and definitions of natural disasters. It specifies payments to victims of natural disasters and defines a natural disaster as a major disaster or a similar situation. The term "victim of a natural disaster" is defined as a person whose financial condition is materially adversely affected by a natural disaster and whose domicile, residence, or principal place of business in the United States, or principal assets in the United States, are located in a natural disaster zone. Section 109(h)(4) of title 11, United States Code, is amended to include "natural disaster" as a qualifying factor for debtors. SEC. 3. AMENDMENT TO CHAPTER 3.

Section 362(b)(22) of title 11, United States Code, is amended to include a debtor who is a victim of a natural disaster.

SEC. 4. AMENDMENTS TO CHAPTER 5.

Section 521 of title 11, United States Code, allows the Court to extend time periods for debtors who are victims of natural disasters.

SEC. 5. AMENDMENTS TO CHAPTER 7. SEC. 5. AMENDMENTS TO CHAPTER 7. The amendment allows debtors who are victims of natural disasters to include necessary expenses in their monthly expenses and prevents the court from dismissing or converting their case under section 707(b). The amendments to Chapter 11 of title 11, United States Code include allowing debtors affected by natural disasters to file a plan, extending time for small businesses, and providing relief for debtors unable to meet deadlines due to natural disasters. Chapter 11 of title 11, United States Code is amended to include provisions for debtors affected by natural disasters, such as allowing them to file a plan and providing relief for missed deadlines. Chapter 11 of title 11, United States Code is amended to include provisions for debtors affected by natural disasters, allowing them to file a plan and providing relief for missed deadlines. Additionally, a new section, Sec. 1117, is added to extend deadlines for small businesses in a small business case if necessary to protect creditors and the estate or warranted by a natural disaster. SEC. 7. AMENDMENTS TO CHAPTER 13.

(a) Section 1307(e) of title 11, United States Code, is amended to allow the Court to extend time periods for debtors affected by natural disasters.
(b) Section 1308 is also amended to provide extensions for filing prepetition tax returns in cases of natural disasters.

SEC. 8. AMENDMENT TO TITLE 28 OF THE UNITED STATES CODE. SEC. 8. AMENDMENT TO TITLE 28 OF THE UNITED STATES CODE. This section amends Section 1408 of title 28, allowing cases under title 11 to be commenced in a district court based on natural disaster victim residency. Effective October 18, 2005, these amendments apply to cases initiated on or after October 17, 2005.
